Creating PDF files using R markdown

Paul Northrop

Source: vignettes/stat0002-creating-pdf-files-vignette.Rmd
stat0002-creating-pdf-files-vignette.Rmd

STAT0004: R Markdown tutorial at the end of Term 1.

R Markdown from RStudio.

Helper wrapper files in stat0002.

  • stat0002::word().
  • stat0002::html()

Command line using accessr or using the Knit button.

Look at the STAT0004/STAT0006 Moodle pages

Cut-and-paste using a Word Processor

This is the least elegant and most time-consuming approach, but it can be useful …

PDF

Accessibility (links). May not matter for your personal use.

Via Word using accessr

Windows users 

> library(accessr)
Warning: package 'accessr' was built under R version 4.4.3

Either

  • OfficeToPDF works only on a Windows operating system.

or following the general instructons for Mac / linux users below.

Mac / linux users

  • Create the Word file using rmd2word().
  • (Perhaps convert it to an alternative format.)
  • Open it in a Word Processor and print to PDF.

Via HTML using Google print

  • PDF file is not accessible

Directly, using LaTeX

  • Requires a LaTeX installation
  • PDF file is not accessible
